refnamediv.refpurpose: obtain number of readable bytes buffered in an SSL object

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: SSL_pending() returns the number of bytes which are available inside ssl for immediate read.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: Data are received in blocks from the peer. Therefore data can be buffered inside ssl and are ready for immediate retrieval with SSL_read 3 .

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: The number of bytes pending is returned.

refsection.title: BUGS
refsection.para: SSL_pending() takes into account only bytes from the TLS/SSL record that is currently being processed (if any). If the SSL object's read_ahead flag is set (see SSL_CTX_set_read_ahead 3 ), additional protocol bytes may have been read containing more TLS/SSL records; these are ignored by SSL_pending().
Up to OpenSSL 0.9.6, SSL_pending() does not check if the record type of pending data is application data.
